result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J Flessert

defendant.name: Flessert, Jesse J

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Jesse J Flessert in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Jesse J Flessert.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Halyburton and Flessert have complaint, has gone over it with him, waives further reading, requests PH, waiving time limits. Court continues bond, considers time limits waived, sets for PH on 10/26/22 at 1:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:08 AM Defendant Jesse J Flessert not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State reviews file, asks for bench warrant, body or $500.00. Court reviews file, does note that the NOH came back for today's hearing but was sent to the address that he gave us and was also in court when date was set, issues bench warrant, body or $500.00. Flessert now appears at 9:11 AM. Court asks the defendant why he was not here on time. Flessert responds, stuck in construction traffic. Court will quash the warrant that was just issued, continues bond, informs defendant that his NOH came back. Flessert not sure why his mail keeps coming back, states he did not get the complaint either. Court asks his progress on contacting either SPD or an attorney. Flessert responds, has not called yet because he does not have a phone as the jail confiscated his phone, just started a job on Monday. Court will allow one more adjournment, continues bond, sets for AIA on 10/5/22 at 10:30 AM, start contacting SPD today and warns of ramifications of appearing without counsel or without information from SPD, given court appointed attorney form in court, also given complaint in Court.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return to sender, attempted- not known

9:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J Flessert appeared by video. Court questions why he is not present in court today. Flessert explains car problems. Court will proceed today, will not issue a warrant and will proceed today. Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court questions his current address. Flessert updates to his mother's address. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has not, has not had charges in FC, not sure how it works. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney; private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Defendant understands and will contact SPD. Lost connection with Flessert, 9:59 AM. Back on record 10:18 AM. Court will have scheduled for AIA and must appear in person. Court sets $500 signature bond, which has been signed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
